turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Does that mean we are, or we aren't?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: We are...

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Then let's act like friends. Let's talk.  I know this is a new place, and --

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: -- If there's a girl, we could talk about her.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I'm tired now.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Wait a minute, kiddo.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Mom... please.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Max is coming for dinner, Michael. I'd like you to meet him.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Can't.  Got plans of my own.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: There's only three weeks left of summer, Michael.  Things are going to change around here when school starts.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Gotta go, Mom.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I <u>didn't</u> invite you in this time!

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Michael!...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Get out, Mom!  Run!

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: We're getting close...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What's that smell?

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Ocean air!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Smells like something died.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Guys, I know it hasn't been easy... the divorce and now the move...  but I think you're really going to like living in Santa Carla...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Mom, there's an amusement park right on the beach!

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: That's the boardwalk, Sam.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Can we go now, huh? LUCY Maybe later.  Grandpa's expecting us.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Tell them to get something to eat.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I thought we were poor.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Not that poor.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: When you ran away from home, hitch- hiked to Berkeley, spent the night in Golden Gate Park and begged for spare change in the morning?

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: You've heard this story before?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: So many times, I'm starting to think it happened to me.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Help me, Mom.  Help.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Soon.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: He met a girl.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: I guess no one cares what I got a job.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Can we get a T.V.?

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Lights out, Sam.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Soon as I finish this comic.  Okay?

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Sam.  Is everything all right?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Mom.  I think we've got to have a long talk about something?

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: What's wrong?  Tell me.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: We can't talk about it on the phone.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Sam!  What happened!?  You had me scared to death.  Are you all right?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Sorry, Mom.  It was a mistake. I thought I saw something out the window.  I was reading this horror comic and I guess I go a little carried away...

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Where's Michael?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: He's already gone to bed.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Can I sleep in here with you tonight?

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: In here?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Do you mind?  It was a real scary comic.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Okay.  Have you been eating pizza?  You smell like garlic.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: These are my dinner guests. Edgar and Alan.  The Frog Brothers.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Ah... I didn't know you were having guests...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Well if we're in your way we can just eat peanut butter out of the jar in the kitchen.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: No, no... there's plenty for everybody... Oh, Max, this is Sam... and the Frog Brothers...

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Nanook, stop breathin' on me.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: C'mere, Nanook.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Oh, no.  Now what?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Must be a circuit breaker.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: What did you say?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Vampires, Mom!  Everywhere! You've got to tell the police! The newspapers!  The TV stations! They'll listen to you.  They'll believe you...  you're a <u>mom</u>!

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Not funny, Sam!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: This is not a joke.  They know that we know about them.  They're coming to the house as soon as it gets dark!

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Stop it, Sam.  Stop it right now!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: But, Mom...

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Not another word!  I can't believe you're doing this.  I'm going to see Max tonight and you're trying to ruin it for me again.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: No, I'm not...

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: There's nothing wrong with Max.  I don't know why you don't --

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: -- I'm not talking about Max!  To hell with Max!

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Ohmygod...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Mom!

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: What happened?  Is everybody all right?!

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You've got a generous nature.  I like that in a person.  My name is Max.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Lucy.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: So what can I help you find tonight, Lucy?  We've got it all.  Best selection in Santa Carla.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: I'm not looking for a tape.  What I need is --

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: -- a job.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Do I look that needy?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Say hello to Thorn.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Hi, Thorn.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: You're cute, Max.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I know.  It's so 'Eighties.'  It's the Cute Decade.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Not impressed, are you?

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Ohm I would have been... one marriage ago.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: So, I've met the one woman on the planet who's going to hold my success against me.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: You seem like a terrific guy, Max, and I'm grateful for the job...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: But I don't think it's what you really want to do, is it?

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: I guess if I had my choice, I'd like to do something that involves children.  Work with kids in some way.  Teenagers, maybe.  And Santa Carla seems to be full of them.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yeah.  Runaways, mostly.  They come from all over.  Attracted by the boardwalk and the ocean.  Lucy... listen I know I have no right to ask you this... but don't look for another job just yet... I mean besides being the best employee I have... I think you're cute.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: I hear this is the decade for cute.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Is it okay for the guest to see the food before the dinner?

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: You're thinking of the groom not seeing the bride before the wedding.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Oh, right.  I always gets those two confused.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: This looks terrific, Lucy.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Boy!  <u>Somebody</u> areound here sure has bad breath!

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Max!  What's wrong?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: It's <u>garlic</u>!!  I like garlic, but...

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: I'm really sorry, Max.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Our batting average isn't very good is it?  So far we're zero for two.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: I don't understand Sam.  He's just not like this.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Boys Sam's age need a good deal of discipline, or they walk all over you.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: He doesn't walk all over me.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I don't want to fight with you, Lucy.  Come on.  Let's give it one more try.  Dinner at my house, tomorrow night.  I'm cooking.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Maybe this is the night where everything finally goes right for a change.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: I hope so.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Something the matter?

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: No, no.  Just worrying about my boys -- as usual.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Let me tell you something about boys.  They're like weeds.  They grow best when they're ignored.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: I thought you said they needed discipline?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Well... what do I know?  I'm a bachelor.  Lucy... this is going to be a very special night, I promise you.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Max... what are you talking about?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: It was all going to be so perfect, Lucy.  One big happy family.  My boys... and <u>yours</u>.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Will somebody please tell me what this is all about!?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: It's you I was after all along, Lucy.  To be our day time guardian. I knew if we could bring Sam and Michael into the faimly, there'd be no way you could say no.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: How about a little Parmesan cheese on that?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Okay, Sam.  Thanks.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Does it burn?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Burn??  Are you kidding?  It's freezing!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I am?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yeah.  I'm not trying to replace your Dad... or steal your Mom.  I just want to be your friend.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: But you passed the test!

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Michael invited me in.  Never invite a vampire into your house. It renders you powerless.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What?!  Did you know that!?

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: Are you following me?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Well, I...

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: Did you want to talk to me?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Well... yeah.  Sure.

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: Okay.  Talk.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I just wanted to... I, uh...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Hi...

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: If you want your ear pierced, I'll do it.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: What's your name?

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: Star.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Oh.  Your folks, too, huh?

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Ex-hippies.  My mom was one.   I came this close to being called Moon Child, or Moon Beam or something.  But Star's great.  I <u>like</u> Star.

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: Me, too.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I'm Michael.

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: Michael's great.  I like Michael.

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: I guess you're new around here.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Sort of.  We used to come here summers when I was kid.  Now we're here on a permanent basis.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Are you hungry?  Wanna get something to eat?

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Ouch.

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: Don't be a baby.  That didn't hurt and you know it.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I wouldn't have given my Mom such a hard time about moving here if I'd known I was going to meet you.

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: I used to fight with my family all the time... just got fed up and ran away.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Now you and David...

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: No.  They've made me one of them, but I miss my family.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Let's go see them.

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: No... no, everything's different now...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I have to talk to you.  Please wake up.

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: Have to sleep.  Have to sleep, Michael.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: When?

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: Tonight.  At the boardwalk...

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: I have to talk to you.  Can I come up?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Do you know where David took me tonight, Star?  Do you?!

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: Yes... and I'm to blame for it. If you hadn't met me... if I hadn't liked you... I tried to warn you...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: That night in the cave -- that wasn't wine they gave me to drink... it was blood!  David's blood.  I'm one of them, Star!  I'm just like them!

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: Not yet... You're like Laddie and me... Half-vampires... You're not a full vampire until you've made your first kill... You were supposed to be mine... but I couldn't, Michael.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: Because I love you...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Then it's not too late for us...

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: It's not too late for you to be saved... but each night... it becomes harder and harder for me to resist killing...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I know, I've felt it...

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: I'm weak... Soon I'll need to feed.

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: David's looking for me... I have to go.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You're not going anywhere...  Sam...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You've got to put this on.

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: Take laddie.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: Save Laddie first.

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: They'll be coming for Laddie and me, won't they?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: They'll be coming for <u>all</u> of us.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: It's gone.  I feel it!

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: So do I!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What!?  He <u>can</u> and I <u>can't</u>?!  No fair!!

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: That's okay, Mom.  I can see it later.  I'll help you unload.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: This is kind of a cool place.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'm so excited I just can't hide it.  I'm about to lode control and I think I like it.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Will you give Mom a break?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Grandpa does not own a T.V.  Have you noticed?  There's no T.V. Santa Carla has no malls, no Cineplexes and now I won't even have MTV.  I will not know anything hip happening anymore.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Hey, Sam, we're flat broke.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Even poor people have T.V.s

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: This room is mine.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I was here first.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Okay.  I'll flip you for it.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You're beautiful.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Wanna change my hair, my clothes, my face.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Where are we going?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Nowhere.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Then what's the rush?  You're chasing that girl, why don't you just admit it?  I'm at the mercy of your sex glands!

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Don't you have something better to do than follow me around all night?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Mom, you hitched all the way to Berkeley once, remember?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Mom, just give me five more minutes. Just five minutes, okay?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Do I have to do this?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Come on, Sam, you know before there were malls there was 'like the ocean.'

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Go away.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You're supposed to watch me and entertain me, and make me appreciate the brief but happy years of childhood.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Entertain yourself.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What did <u>you</u> do last night?  You look wasted.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I can't remember much after the Chinese food that looked like maggots.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You don't suppose Grandpa's an alien, do you?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: What would that make Mom?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You're right... not even to mention you and me.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Did you spill something?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: No.  Why?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: The bottoms of your feet are covered with salt.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I told you it was pretty weird Chinese food.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Wanna go to the comic book store?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Mom's home?...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: No.  On the phone.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'm making you a sandwich.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Don't bother.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Lose the earring, Michael.  It's not happening.  It's just not happening.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Piss off.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You have such a great personality, Michael.   You should open your own charm school.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Michael?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Don't turn on the light.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What happened, Michael!?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Nanook...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What about Nonook?  What have you done to Nanook?!  What have you done to my dog, you asshole?!

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Nothing!  I didn't hurt him.  <u>He</u> bit <u>me</u>!  This is <u>my</u> blood!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What did you to do him, Michael? Why did he bite you?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: He was protecting <u>you</u>!

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: What??

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Look at your reflection in the mirror!!

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: We've got to stick together, Sam. You've got to help me.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What about Mom?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: No!  We can't tell Mom!  Please, Sam.  Don't tell her.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I don't know, Michael.  This is not like breaking a lamp or getting a 'D'.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Just for a few days, Sam.  Give me a chance to work this out by myself.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: It's that girl from the boardwalk. Is she one of them?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Star.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Don't kill anybody until we get back to you...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Who are you calling?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: The Marines.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Michael!  Get behind the wheel.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Huh?...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What's the matter?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I... I don't feel any differently.  Do you?

turns.speaker: BENNINGS
turns.text: Sixteen.

turns.speaker: MACREADY
turns.text: And the horse you rode in on. Sixteen for how long?!  You can't predict this time of year...

turns.speaker: BENNINGS
turns.text: What do you want from us?

turns.speaker: MACREADY
turns.text: Just listen.

turns.speaker: BENNINGS
turns.text: Pretty nasty out, Mac.  Thirty-five knots.

turns.speaker: MACREADY
turns.text: Screw it, I'm going up anyway.

turns.speaker: BENNINGS
turns.text: All right... Box of dynamite... box of thermite... three shotguns... box of flares... two flare guns... thirty cans gasoline... and a case of alcohol.

turns.speaker: MACREADY
turns.text: Let's load 'em.

turns.speaker: MACREADY
turns.text: Maybe dinner.

turns.speaker: BENNINGS
turns.text: Dogs don't eat each other.

turns.speaker: MACREADY
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: MACREADY
turns.text: Where these tracks headed?

turns.speaker: BENNINGS
turns.text: Nowhere... Just straight to the ocean.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: What do you mean "got" to the dog?

turns.speaker: BLAIR
turns.text: It was a life form that was able to imitate and reproduce, whatever it ate or absorbed, cell for cell.

turns.speaker: BLAIR
turns.text: Clark, did you notice anything strange about that dog?  Just anything at all?  Any little thing?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: No.  Just that he recovered real quick... That night when I found him in the rec room, he had already scraped off his bandage.  Before I put him with the others, I redressed his wound and noticed it had healed up real good...

turns.speaker: BLAIR
turns.text: That night?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: BLAIR
turns.text: What was he doing in the rec room?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Well, after I worked on him -- thought I'd let him rest.  Left the room for a bit.  When I came back, he was gone.

turns.speaker: BLAIR
turns.text: Well, where was he?  Where did he go?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Don't know.  Looked for him for a bit... couldn't find him.

turns.speaker: BLAIR
turns.text: You're saying he wasn't put into the kennel until the night?

turns.speaker: BLAIR
turns.text: How long were you with the dog? Alone, I mean?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Ah... He was hurt bad.  Bullet nicked an artery... I don't know... An hour... hour and a half...

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: What the hell you looking at me like that for?

turns.speaker: BLAIR
turns.text: Nothing.  Nothing at all.

turns.speaker: BLAIR
turns.text: Was that dog, the Norwegian dog?

turns.speaker: GARRY
turns.text: I just can't comprehend any of this. It was just a dog.

turns.speaker: GARRY
turns.text: Couldn't make much of it myself.

turns.speaker: BLAIR
turns.text: I've asked him to try and locate the site.  Okay with you?

turns.speaker: GARRY
turns.text: Sure.  You think there's a connection?

turns.speaker: BLAIR
turns.text: Maybe.

turns.speaker: BLAIR
turns.text: Look, I know it's hard to believe...

turns.speaker: GARRY
turns.text: So what's our problem?

turns.speaker: BLAIR
turns.text: Well... there's still some cell activity... it's not entirely dead yet.

turns.speaker: BLAIR
turns.text: ... It could have gotten to somebody...

turns.speaker: GARRY
turns.text: Anybody sick?

turns.speaker: BLAIR
turns.text: No, I... I don't mean infection... or disease...

turns.speaker: BLAIR
turns.text: Listen to me, Garry.  Please...

turns.speaker: GARRY
turns.text: If the weather clears enough before we reach anybody -- I'm sending you and Doc up to MacMurdo...

turns.speaker: BLAIR
turns.text: Don't you understand?!  That Thing didn't want to become a dog...

turns.speaker: GARRY
turns.text: Damn you, Blair!  You've already got everybody half-hysterical around here.

turns.speaker: BLAIR
turns.text: You can't let anybody leave!

turns.speaker: GARRY
turns.text: I've got six dead Norwegians on my hands, a burned up flying saucer, and we've just destroyed the scientific find of the century.  Now fuck off!

turns.speaker: BLAIR
turns.text: Whatever that Norwegian dog was... It... It was capable of changing its form...  ... when it attacked our dog... it somehow was able to digest... or... absorb it... and in the process shaped its own cells to imitate our dog's cells exactly...  ... This for instance isn't dog at all -- it's imitation... We got to it before it had time to finish or...

turns.speaker: NAULS
turns.text: Finish what?

turns.speaker: BLAIR
turns.text: ... I think the whole process would have taken an hour... maybe more. And then I suppose both would have changed back to dog form.

turns.speaker: NAULS
turns.text: What you doin'?

turns.speaker: BLAIR
turns.text: Nobody's getting in here.  You can tell them all that!

turns.speaker: NAULS
turns.text: Well, who the hell you think wants to get in there with you?

turns.speaker: NAULS
turns.text: Now why'd you go and...

turns.speaker: BLAIR
turns.text: And I don't want any more food with sedatives in it.  I know what you're up to.  Don't think I don't.  And if anyone tries to get in here -- I've got rope.  I'll hang myself before it gets to me.

turns.speaker: NAULS
turns.text: You promise?

turns.speaker: MACREADY
turns.text: Too damn dangerous.

turns.speaker: BLAIR
turns.text: ... You think this Thing wants to become an animal?  Dogs can't make it 1000 miles to the sea.  No skua gulls to imitate this time of year... No penguins this far inland... Don't you understand?!  It wanted to become us!

turns.speaker: BLAIR
turns.text: ... Can't you see...?  If one cell of this Thing got out it could imitate every living thing on Earth. Nothing could stop it!  Nothing!

turns.speaker: MACREADY
turns.text: Look Blair, maybe you're right about this.  But we've got to be rational. We've got to talk this over.  I'm unarmed and I'm coming in.

turns.speaker: BLAIR
turns.text: No, you're not!  I don't trust any of you!
